questions.question: 1. A body is subjected to stresses in XY plane with stresses of 60N/mm<sup>2</sup> and 80N/mm<sup>2</sup> acting along X and Y axes respectively. Also the shear stress acting is 20N/mm<sup>2</sup>. Find the minimum normal stress.

explanations.a:
Minimum normal stress is given by:
σ = [σ(X) + σ(Y)]/2 - √ ([σ(X)-σ(Y)]2/22 + τ2)
explanations.b:
Minimum normal stress is given by:
σ = [σ(X) + σ(Y)]/2 - √ ([σ(X)-σ(Y)]2/22 + τ2)
explanations.c:
Minimum normal stress is given by:
σ = [σ(X) + σ(Y)]/2 - √ ([σ(X)-σ(Y)]2/22 + τ2)
explanations.d:
Minimum normal stress is given by:
σ = [σ(X) + σ(Y)]/2 - √ ([σ(X)-σ(Y)]2/22 + τ2)

questions.question: 2. A body is subjected to stresses in XY plane with stresses of 60N/mm<sup>2</sup> and 80N/mm<sup>2</sup> acting along X and Y axes respectively. Also the shear stress acting is 10N/mm<sup>2</sup>. Find the inclination of the plane for which shear stress is maximum.

explanations.a:
Inclination(Ǿ) is given by:
tan(2Ǿ) = 2τ/[σ(X) – σ(Y)].

Inclination(Ǿ) is given by:
tan(2Ǿ) = 2τ/[σ(X) – σ(Y)].
